intro: Elatostema celaticaule, commonly known as the slender-stemmed elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant typically has a short, erect stem and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which can contribute to its overall appearance and ecological interactions.
